Timeline of Game Boy Events

This visual timeline’s release data and cover images is sourced from GameFAQs. Feel free to contact me with any addition or errata at pl@gameboyessentials.com.

Any data only available in a yearly range (mostly European releases for which only the calendar year of their release is available) are currently ignored and not visible on this timeline.

Japan
North America Europe

1980

April

  • Ball, the first Game & Watch, is released in Japan. ※

1983

July

  • The Family Computer is released in Japan. ※

1987

June

  • The Game Boy project is started within R&D1. ※

1989

April

Developed by
Nintendo
Published by

Developed by

Published by

Yakuman

Developed by
Intelligent Systems
Published by
Nintendo
  • Game Boy is released in Japan for ¥12,500 with Super Mario Land, Alleyway, Baseball, and Yakuman. No game is bundled with the unit, as is customary in Japan. ※

  • Mickey Mouse is released in Japan, which will become The Bugs Bunny Crazy Castle upon its North American release. ※
  • Motocross Maniacs is released in Japan. It is Konami’s first Game Boy title. ※

  • Makai Toushi SaGa, the first RPG for the Game Boy, is released in Japan. It will become The Final Fantasy Legend upon its release in North America. ※
  • Selection: Erabareshi Mono is released in Japan. It will become The Sword of Hope upon its release in North America. ※

2004

September

  • The Game Boy Advance SP is reduced in price in Japan, the US and Canada. It is now sold for $79 USD, down from $99, or ¥9800 in Japan. ※

2007

April

  • In its financial statements, Nintendo forecasts no sales of Game Boy Advance hardware going forward, and forecasts eight million software sales for the next financial year. This means no new Game Boy Advance hardware is produced, and only stock already on shelves is still sold. Nintendo has closed the books on the Game Boy name. ※
